owl:Ontology.terms:description: The Evidence Graph ontology extends core concepts from the W3C Provenance Ontology PROV-O and Bioschemas' Profiles to describe evidence for correctness of findings in biomedical publications. The semantic data model in EVI is expressed using OWL2 Web Ontology Language (OWL2).
owl:Ontology.terms:title: EVI: Evidence Graph Ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of associatedWith property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: associateFor

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A prov:Agent that has some responsibility for the occurrence of this prov:Activity is associatedWith the prov:Activity.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: associatedWith

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of challenges property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: challengedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The challenges property is entailed by property chain rule when a DigitalObject A either directly challenges another DigitalObject B, or indirectlyChallenges B by challenging a DigitalObject which supports it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: challenges

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of contains property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: containedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Instances of DigitalObjects may contain instances of other DigitalObjects.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The contentUrl property provides the access to the actual byes of the DigitalContent that can be downloaded and examined.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contentUrl

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of createdBy property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: created

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A prov:Agent is a creator of a prov:Entity if it is createdBy the Agent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: createdBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The dataSchema property describes the content-level schema of a DigitalObject that may be distributed in one or more ways.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dataSchema

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of usedDataset property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: datasetUsedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A derivation is a transformation of a prov:Entity into another, an update of a prov:Entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new prov:Entity based on a pre-existing prov:Entity.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: derivedFrom

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of derivedFrom property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: derivedTo

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of describes property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: describedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The describes property is used when a Method, generally composed with a block of text, narrates a prov:Activity that takes place.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: describes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of directlyChallenges property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: directlyChallengedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The directlyChallenges property establishes a relation between instances of DigitalObjects A and B when A asserts that B is wrong or deficient. It is non-transitive, entailing indirectlyChallenges properties on DigitalObjects supportedBy the DigitalObject it directlyChallenges, via a property chain rule.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: directlyChallenges

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The use of directlySupportedBy property is intended to establish a direct relation between instances of DigitalObjects.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: directlySupportedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The directlySupports property is a non-transitive version of supports, a subproperty of supports. directlySupports is a superproperty of the properties attributed (inverse of attributedTo), derived (inverse of derivedFrom), associated (inverse of associatedWith), used, and generated (inverse of generatedBy).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: directlySupports

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of hasDistribution property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: distributedFrom

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of generatedBy property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: generated

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Generation is the completion of production of a new prov:Entity by a prov:Activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: generatedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Used to represent different forms of a DigitalObject. An image may be distributed as a JPEG, PNG, or SVG.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasDistribution

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of indirectlyChallenges property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: indirectlyChallengedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The indirectlyChallenges property establishes a relation between instances of DigitalObjects when one indirectly challenges the other entailed by property chaining.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: indirectlyChallenges

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of packages property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: packagedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Instances of software can be packaged by the instances of containers.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: packages

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of represents property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: representedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A DigitalObject represents an Entity or any of its features or feature sets.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: represents

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of usedService property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: serviceUsedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of usedSoftware property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: softwareUsedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The supportedBy property is a transitive relation between DigitalObjects.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: supportedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The supports property is a transitive relation between DigitalObjects entailed by its subproperty, directlySupports, which is non-transitive. In EvidenceGraphs, if A supports B, then the correctness (truth value) of A provides a warrant for belief in the correctness (truth value) of B.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: supports

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An Activity used an Entity, when the Entity (such as a Dataset or a Software) was instrumental in enabling that Activity to occur.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: used

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reverse of used property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: usedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The property usedDataset is a subproperty of used where domain is Computation and range is Dataset.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: usedDataset

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The property usedService is a subproperty of used where domain is Computation and range is Service.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: usedService

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The property usedSoftware is a subproperty of used where domain is Computation and range is Software.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: usedSoftware

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The author of the content.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:author

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: File size in (tera/giga/mega/kilo) bytes.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:contentSize

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Date when the item was created.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:dateCreated

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The date when the item was modifed last.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:dateModified

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Date when the item was first published.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:datePublished

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A description of the item.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:description

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The format of the item in question encoded into.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:encodingFormat

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file. Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:endTime

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:fileFormat

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:keywords

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:license

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The name of the item.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (example: Java v1, Python 2.3, .NET Framework 3.0).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:runtime

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file. Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:startTime

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The title of a Thing.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:title

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The version of the DigitalObject.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: schema:version

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Any additional information of the item that may be useful.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: additionalDocumentation

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Refenrece to the publications where the item or its relevant information can be discovered.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: associatedPublication

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The (digital/physical) name where the item was published.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: publicationVenue

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Textual representation of a claim
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: state

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Article

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Claim in Schema.org represents a specific, factually-oriented claim that could be the itemReviewed in a ClaimReview. The content of a claim can be summarized with the text property. Variations on well known claims can have their common identity indicated via sameAs links, and summarized with a name. Ideally, a Claim description includes enough contextual information to minimize the risk of ambiguity or inclarity. In practice, many claims are better understood in the context in which they appear or the interpretations provided by claim reviews. Beyond ClaimReview, the Claim type can be associated with related creative works - for example a ScholaryArticle or Question might be about some Claim. At this time, Schema.org does not define any types of relationship between claims. This is a natural area for future exploration.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Claim

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Dataset

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:Service

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A software application.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:SoftwareApplication

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: schema:SoftwareSourceCode

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A bundle is a named set of provenance descriptions, and is itself an Entity, so allowing provenance of provenance to be expressed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Bundle

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Service is considered a SoftwareAgent that can be invoked and executed. A Software is different from SoftwareAgent in the context that it can be downloaded.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:SoftwareAgent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Article is a (typically compound) textual document conveying a set of Claims and other DigitalObjects. Among these, an Article in EVI always conveys an assertion of its authorship in the form of a bibliographic self-reference.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Article

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Claim is a declarative sentence or assertion. Claims are defeasible.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Claim

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Computation is an Activity performed on a Dataset with the help of a Software.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Computation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A container is a digital object that can be defined as packages of software. Instances of containers are accompanied by all necessary dependencies such as specific versions, runtime environment and required libraries for execution.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Container

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A DigitalObject is an Entity which represents another Entity. DigitalObjects are always attributedTo an Agent, their creator, contributor, influencer or to an Activity they were generatedBy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DigitalObject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The placement of instances of DigitalObjects. A single DigitalObject may be represented in multiple forms, hence resulting in multiple distributions. An Image can be encoded and distributed as any of the JPEG, PNG, SVG.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Distribution

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An EvidenceGraph is a directed acyclic graph Ev = (Rn, r+, r-) where Rn is a set of Representations, r+ ∈ RnXRn is a set of supports relations, r- ∈ RnXRn is a set of challenge relations, and R+∩R- = Φ. EvidenceGraphs are bipolar argumentation frameworks (Cayrol & Lagasquie-Schiex, 2009) represented as RDF named graphs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EvidenceGraph

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Image is a visual representation of structured or unstructured data produced digitally.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Image

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A descriptive recipe describing how a Representation is made or obtained. It describes an Activity, and may referTo some Material as a component of the recipe.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Method

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Reference is a bibliographic record. References are Representations which represent and attribute archived digital or bibliographic objects, including Articles, Datasets, and Software.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reference

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A semi-structured interpretation of instances of DigitalObjects that can help comprehend the content.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Schema

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Service is an Activity accessed online, which executes a Computation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Service

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Software is a specific set of computer-interpretable instructions to perform one or more Computations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Activity is a process by which an Entity is produced, modified, consumed or used.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Agent is an autonomous Entity. Persons and Organizations are Agents in EVI. Agents may be associatedWith Activities, and Entities may be attributedTo Agents.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Agent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Organization is a social or legal institution with structure and purpose such as a company, society, university, sports team, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Person is a human Agent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: prov:Person

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An entity responsible for making the resource. Examples of a creator include a person, an organization, or a service i.e. a SoftwareAgent. Typically, the name of a creator should be used to indicate the entity.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: terms:creator
